intro: Phacelia formosula, commonly known as the pink phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive blue-green color. Phacelia formosula is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
